_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Famous Vineyards has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Famous Vineyards, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Famous Vineyards has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name               | Process Chemical               | Process Quantity(lbs.)
P1 Old Cold Storage          Anhydrous Ammonia       20,000
P2 New Cold Storage        Anhydrous Ammonia       120,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM r

egulation to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Descriptions

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Famous Vineyards operates a commercial cold storage for table grapes in Richgrove, CA. The facility has two (2) ammonia refrigeration systems that provide refrigeration capacity to the following:

Process 1 - Old Cold Storage
(7) Cold Storage Rooms
(3) Precool Rooms
(1) Hallway

Process 2 - New Cold Storage
(10) Cold Storage Rooms
(2) Precool Rooms
(2) Hallways
(1) Shipping Dock

1.2.2 Facility Location

Famous Vineyards is located at 20715 Avenue 8, Delano, CA 93215. The latitude and longitude of the largest high pressure receiver on site is 35.803825, -119.110426. The facility is located approximately 8 miles east of State Highway 99 and 1,000 ft west of Famoso Porterville Highway in a rural area surrounded primarily by agricultural land and residential areas including a school.

Flood Hazards
According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard.

Seismic Susceptibility
Famous Vineyards is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps fault maps showed that faults within close proximity are not considered high risk
Mt. Poso Fault - <1,600,000 Years
Poso Creek Fault - <1,600,000 Years
New Hope Fault - <150 Years
Pound Fault - <150 Years

The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Famous Vineyards has a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Processes

The refrigerated spaces ar

e equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operations. The Grape Repack Line is equipped with air-cooling evaporators as required for direct-expansion.

Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within, directly above, or outside the respective machinery rooms.
 
Process Classification

Each ammonia refrigeration system at Famous Vineyards consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. The systems are neither interconnected nor co-located relative to each other. As such, the refrigeration systems at Famous Vineyards are treated as two (2) independent processes.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Famous Vineyards has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration processes. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Famous Vineyards facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigera

tion contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History
Famous Vineyards has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Famous Vineyards' emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- Cal/OSHA's Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR §3220
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans - Title 29 CFR §1910.38
- Cal/OSHA's Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 8 CCR §5189(n)
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements] - Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 §2765.1-2765.2
- USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 40 CFR §68.95
- California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans and Procedures] - Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4 §2731
- California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 §5192(q)
- Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR §1910.120(q)

Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Famous Vineyards has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Ne

vertheless, Famous Vineyards continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Famous Vineyards' ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Famous Vineyards' management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Famous Vineyards has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Famous Vineyards has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Famous Vineyards now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Famous Vineyards employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Famous Vineyards will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
